file_content.text: I see why Bareesh hired you. You're top-of-the-line.
Nice meeting you. Try not to get yourself killed.
Bareesh and your ambassador want a private chat on the holo. I'll put you on with them.
Your attack on those gangster scum reaped unexpected benefits. They revealed a new den of evil to us!
We intercepted a holomessage ordering the Kintan Kings to protect their slave market. They're selling kidnapped Republic citizens!
Putting slavers out of business is always a pleasure.
I'll happily end that.
You'll want to act quickly on this, Master Jedi.
These criminals are truly depraved.
How despicable.
It's much worse than you think, Master Jedi.
Rescuing civilians is always tricky, but I'm up for it.
Not for long.
I'm afraid this will be an especially dangerous rescue.
Gangsters like credits--make them an offer.
Then buy our people back.
If you knew who these victims were, you wouldn't make crass jokes.
Is the news reliable?
Our people have been disappearing for weeks. I thought they were being murdered, but now we know better.
How is that my problem?
We can't stand by while innocent people are sold to criminals!
Some of the kidnapping victims are Force-sensitive children who were passing through here on their way to the Jedi.
I shudder to think what those criminal scum have in mind for the children.
No one's harming innocents while I'm around.
I'll keep them safe.
Nothing good, I'm sure.
The Sith Empire is always looking for new children to train on Korriban.
Time to kill some bad guys.
This calls for precision tactics. We don't want any innocents getting hurt.
Bareesh believes the gang's slave market is in the ruins of an old casino.
It used to be a very fine establishment. The Kintan Kings do not deserve such splendor!
It's time to finish this.
I'll go there now.
Yes--I hope you kill them all! And save the children.
Easy there, Bareesh.
Forgive me. I am excited by the prospect of justice.
Your priorities are suspect.
What have I said to earn your mistrust? I'm deeply concerned for the children.
There's no need to discuss this further. Please hurry--free our people before it's too late.
Welcome to Nurkolas Arms. If it shoots, stabs, fries or detonates, I stock it.
I see you've got Bareesh's combat implants. He'll be a happy Hutt.
Gotta say, I expected a lot more Jedi after the Kintan Kings slaughtered that other one. You're all they sent?
Jedi leave law enforcement to the proper authorities.
This isn't a police action.
Proper authorities? On Nar Shaddaa? You just landed here, didn't you?
The galaxy is huge and the Jedi are few.
We're not an army.
Getting fewer all the time, from what I've seen.
I'm here to pick up the Jedi slack.
Yes, and Havoc Squad.
Yes, you look like someone good at heavy lifting.
Jedi don't like getting their hands dirty, but I do.
I'm all they need.
Then you've come to the right place.
What's with all the armor and heavy weapons? Nar Shaddaa's neutral territory.
The Republic and the Jedi go where they're needed.
This isn't about borders.
Especially when it suits your agendas.
The Jedi will preserve the balance here.
It will remain so.
Only "balance" I care about is in my bank account.
I'm not here to start a war.
Relax.
Really? The Kintan Kings must be awfully confused.
Personally, I hope it stays that way.
Just how I like it.
I'm sure you'll find a way to profit, regardless.
What's a mercenary spacer like you doing for the Republic's top ambassador?
My friend here enjoys the sound of credits rubbing together.
Profiting, I'm sure.
Sure, but who doesn't?
We keep Captain Smartmouth around for comic relief.
Making him laugh.
Let me guess: When a fight breaks out, you stand in front and the spacer covers the rear.
The pay's good, and I've got expenses to cover.
Earning credits.
I'll just bet you do.
How'd you get mixed up with my boss and Ambassador Averdon, friend?
We're all here for the same reason--to defeat these gangsters.
To stand against evil.
I get the feeling this is personal for you, Master Jedi.
Are you always this curious?
Why so many questions?
It's not every day you meet someone crazy enough to take on the Kintan Kings.
When there's fighting to be done, it falls to people like us.
The hard way.
What the--for a second, I thought my inventory overstock was talking.
I started it. What can I say? I'm a trendsetter.
Imitating me.
We all have our burdens. I'm sure your friends understand what I mean.
It's what I do.
If you say so. I'm more the neutral type, myself.
Skip the questions.
Suit yourself. Just trying to be friendly.
I'm here on vacation.
People like you keep people like me in business--and I really appreciate it.
One thing's for sure, the Mountain won't be happy when he finds out what you did.
That's what they call the Kintan Kings' leader, by the way--"the Mountain." Three guesses why.
He must be very tall.
I assume he's large.
Wookiees are tall. The Mountain ducks when clouds pass overhead.
Gangsters like to sound tougher than they are.
He's overcompensating.
In this case, it's no exaggeration. Saw him once. Wish I hadn't.
I'm not here to play your stupid guessing games.
Enough of this.
Just figured you'd want to know what you're up against.
Only thing the Kintan Kings fear is the Mountain. He's everywhere, all the time.
People who rule by fear always have a vulnerable spot.
He must have a weakness.
Just be careful that you don't trigger an avalanche when you hit the Mountain's weakness.
That seems unlikely.
All I know is, the Mountain has a reputation for staying on top of things. Take care you're not one of them.
What's your point?
You just made the top of the Mountain's to-kill list. I'm concerned for your well-being.
Say... since we're being so cordial and sharing, maybe we can discuss a little side business?
Those combat implants are first-rate merchandise. We could score a sweet profit selling a few on the black market.
That technology is a gift from Bareesh to the Republic.
They don't belong to us.
I'm not saying we take them all. Besides, Bareesh has other gifts.
Do you make a habit of cheating your employer?
You'd betray Bareesh?
Of course not--that would get me killed. I only profit when opportunity knocks.
How much is my cut?
Fifty-fifty split of the profits, with your share paid in advance, 'cause I'm a generous guy.
I'll tell Bareesh the Kintan Kings used some combat implants before you raided them. He'll believe me, long as you don't disagree.
What Bareesh doesn't know won't hurt him--and it'll make us richer. Sound good?
I'm not making any deals with you.
Sounds bad. [Refuse bribe]
Take it easy. I was only kidding. Hey look--Bareesh is on the holo....
We got back all those combat implants, boss.
Wonderful news. Please leave us, Nurkolas.
Yes, I'll lie to Bareesh.
Great! That's Bareesh on the holo. Just play it cool....
Bad news, boss. Couldn't get back all those combat implants. The Kintan Kings must have used a few.
Annoying, but no surprise. Leave us, Nurkolas.
I have Arakyd EJ-25 concussion rifles, still in factory package! Not cheap knockoffs--finest quality!
CUT LINES
